Operator Precedence Example


Syntax


Expression :
    Expression + Mult-Exp
    Expression - Mult-Exp
    Mult-Exp

Mult-Exp :
    Mult-Exp * Negate-Exp
    Mult-Exp / Negate-Exp
    Negate-Exp

Negate-Exp :
    - Value
    Value

Value :
    Id
    Integer
    ( Expression )


Grammar
"Name"    = Operator Precedence Example
"Author"  = Devin Cook
"Version" = Example
"About"   = This grammar demonstrates operator precedence.
 
"Case Sensitive" = False 
"Start Symbol"   = <Expression>
 
Id        = {Letter}{AlphaNumeric}*
Integer   = {Digit}+
 
<Expression>   ::= <Expression> '+' <Mult Exp> 
                 | <Expression> '-' <Mult Exp> 
                 | <Mult Exp> 
 
<Mult Exp>    ::= <Mult Exp> '*' <Negate Exp> 
                | <Mult Exp> '/' <Negate Exp> 
                | <Negate Exp> 
 
<Negate Exp>  ::= '-' <Value> 
                | <Value> 
 
<Value>       ::= ID 
                | Integer
                | '(' <Expression> ')'


Data Tables


Parameters
Name Value
Name Operator Precedence Example
Version Example
Author Devin Cook
About This grammar demonstrates operator precedence.
Start Symbol Expression
Auto Whitespace True
Character Mapping Windows-1252
Case Sensitive False


Terminals
Index Name
0 (EOF)
1 (Error)
2 (Whitespace)
3 '-'
4 '('
5 ')'
6 '*'
7 '/'
8 '+'
9 Id
10 Integer


Nonterminals
Index Name
11 <Expression>
12 <Mult Exp>
13 <Negate Exp>
14 <Value>


Rules
Index Head ::= Handle
0 <Expression> ::= <Expression> '+' <Mult Exp>
1 <Expression> ::= <Expression> '-' <Mult Exp>
2 <Expression> ::= <Mult Exp>
3 <Mult Exp> ::= <Mult Exp> '*' <Negate Exp>
4 <Mult Exp> ::= <Mult Exp> '/' <Negate Exp>
5 <Mult Exp> ::= <Negate Exp>
6 <Negate Exp> ::= '-' <Value>
7 <Negate Exp> ::= <Value>
8 <Value> ::= Id
9 <Value> ::= Integer
10 <Value> ::= '(' <Expression> ')'
